title: How to Hide Sensitive Content on Twitter (Now X)

steps.title: Go the X platform website.
steps.content: Go the X platform website. Open twitter.com in your browser and sign in with your account.

steps.title: Open X Settings.
steps.content: Open X Settings . Click on your profile icon at the top bar and select "Settings and privacy" from the drop-down list.

steps.title: Navigate to the privacy and safety settings.
steps.content: Navigate to the privacy and safety settings . Click on the Privacy and safety from the side panel.

steps.title: Scroll down to the "Safety" section.
steps.content: Scroll down to the "Safety" section. Check the Hide sensitive content check box to prevent Tweets with potentially sensitive content from displaying in your search results.

steps.title: Hide sensitive media.
steps.content: Hide sensitive media. Just uncheck the Display media that may contain sensitive content box.

steps.title: Save your settings.
steps.content: Save your settings. Hit the Save changes button to finish. Done! Your settings will apply to searches on the web, in your iOS or Android app.

steps.title: Log in to X.
steps.content: Log in to X. Visit twitter.com in your browser and sign with your account.

steps.title: Search for something.
steps.content: Search for something. Move to the search box and type something to search and hit the enter button.

steps.title: Click on the 3 dots ( ‎⋮ ) icon.
steps.content: Click on the 3 dots ( ‎⋮ ) icon. Select Search settings from the list.

steps.title: Check the "Hide sensitive content" box.
steps.content: Check the "Hide sensitive content" box. If you want to hide blocked and muted from your search results, also check the Remove blocked and muted box.

steps.title: Save your changes.
steps.content: Save your changes. Click on the Save changes button to hide sensitive content. Your settings will apply to searches on the web, in your iOS or Android app.
